timing
Class TimingController

java.lang.Object
  timing.TimingController

public class TimingController
extends java.lang.Object

TimingController

This class is a utility for performing animations. It layers more functionality on existing timing utilities in Java. It is a simple class whose functionality is mainly in the constructor and in its later calls to the timingEvent() method that subclasses should override.

Field Summary

          Used to specify indefinite Cycle duration or Envelope numCycles

Constructor Detail

TimingController

public TimingController(Cycle cycle,
                        Envelope envelope)
Constructor: sets up all necessary information

Parameters:
cycle - encapsulates the parameters that each timing cycle will use.
envelope - encapsulates the parameters that each envelope will use
See Also:
Cycle, Envelope
Method Detail

start

public void start()
The constructor sets up everything, but start must be called to actually start the timer.

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
Returns whether this TimingController object is currently running

stop

public void stop()
This method is optional; animations will always stop on their own if TimingController is provided with appropriate values for duration and numCycles in the constructor. But if the application wants to stop the timer mid-stream, this is the method to call.

timingEvent

protected void timingEvent(long cycleElapsedTime,
                           long totalElapsedTime,
                           float fraction)
Subclasses should override this method to receive timing events. This default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
cycleElapsedTime - the total time in milliseconds elapsed in the current Cycle
totalElapsedTime - the total time in milliseconds elapsed since the start of the first cycle
fraction - the fraction of completion between the start and end of the current cycle. Note that on reversing cycles (Envelope.RepeatBehavior.REVERSE) the fraction decreases from 1.0 to 0 on backwards-running cycles.
See Also:
Envelope.RepeatBehavior
